item.title: TLDR: Advice for Young INTJs
item.description: Link to post Be Strategic Strategy is, in essence, the ability to make decisions about how to use limited resources to create relative advantages. Develop this skill by thinking in patterns and their connections and outcomes. As an introvert haging out in groups drains your batteries. Only engage with people who are worth it. Don’t make useless friends. Live strategically, don’t just think strategically. When you decide to do something put all your effort in and use the system effectively.

item.title: TLDR: Guzey's Productivity System
item.description: Link to original article If you’ve been procrastinating for most of the day: Accept that you won’t do anything today, and don’t get angry at yourself Set an alarm for when you’ll prep for bed Procrastinate for the rest of the day When the alarm rings pack your laptop and everything else you need for work in your backpack When you wake up leave the house immediately with your backpack Go to a library, caffe, or other place to GSD Return home in the evening Context intentionality as the difference home and every other place on earth

item.title: Who Do I Want to be in Five Years?
item.description: Until today I didn’t have an answer. I didn’t have a clear idea of what I was working towards in life. What did I want to acheive, what kind of person did I want to become? It felt like I was lost, driving without a destination. I spent some time introspecting, here’s my answer: In five years I want to be the guy you go to if you have an awesome idea and need it built.
